html:
137 U.S. 577

11 S.Ct. 185

34 L.Ed. 792

SMITH
v.
GALE et al.

January5, 1891.

Park Davis and A. G. Safford, for appellees.

[578]

Enoch Totten, for appellant.

djQ FULLER, C. J.

1

In computing the two years after the entry of a final

2

judgment, decree, or order sought to be reviewed in this court,

3

within which the writ of error must be brought or the appeal

4

taken, the day of the entry of such judgment, decree, or order

5

should be excluded. Credit Co. v. Arkansas Cent. Ry. Co., 128 U.

6

S. 258, 9 Sup. Ct. Rep. 107. The motion to dismiss the appeal in

7

this cause is therefore denied.
html_lawbox:
137 U.S. 577 (1891)

SMITH
v.
GALE.

No. 580.

Supreme Court of United States.

Submitted December 22, 1890.
Decided January 5, 1891.
APPEAL FROM THE SUPREME COURT OF THE TERRITORY OF DAKOTA.

Mr. A.G. Safford and Mr. Park Davis (with whom was Mr. Melvin Grigsby) for the motion.

Mr. Enoch Totten opposing.

*578 MR. CHIEF JUSTICE FULLER delivered the opinion of the court.

In computing the two years after the entry of a final judgment, decree or order, sought to be reviewed in this court, within which the writ of error must be brought or the appeal taken, the day of the entry of such judgment, decree or order should be excluded. Credit Co. v. Arkansas Central Railway Co., 128 U.S. 258.

The motion to dismiss the appeal in this cause is therefore

Denied.
